title: Is it October 2019 half-term this week and when are the other school holidays?
text:
School’s out for… Halloween? (Picture: Michael Cole/Corbis via Getty Images)

It’s that time again – the middle of October is here and many people out there are wondering when half-term is due to start.

Whether you want to know when half-term will be for your child, or you want to know if you should plan to have loads of school-age kids underfoot for the next week, here’s what you need to know…

Is it October 2019 half-term this week?

Yes, many schools in the Uk are currently on their half-term breaks.

School term dates vary across the country, so it’s always best to check with your local council to be sure.

You can do this by going to the Gov.uk website and typing your postcode into the tool there.

After this October half-term break, the next time schools close their doors will be for the Christmas holidays.

The Christmas break will likely kick-off from Monday, 23 December 2019 and go on until Thursday, 2 January 2020.

Again, this might not be the same for all schools in the UK, so it’s best to check with your local council to be sure.

Soon the kids will be getting a break from this kind of thing (Picture: Andia/Universal Images Group via Getty Images)

The other approximate dates of school breaks for the rest of this academic year are:

Spring half-term: Monday, 17 February 2020 – Friday, 21 February 2020

Easter holidays: Monday, 6 April 2020 – Friday, 17 April 2020

May half-term: Monday, 25 May 2020 – Friday, 29 May 2020

Summer holidays: Wednesday, 15 July 2020 – Tuesday, 1 September 2020
